resource.comment: Come for review. Overall doing better. Mood still low but improving. More good days than bad. Energy levels ok. Motivation improving. Support from neighbour visits daily
MSE euthymic. Not anxious. No DSH/hallucinations/abnormal thoughts
Advised re local walking group

resource.comment: Chest clear
Swelling lower legs bilaterally. Mild pitting oedema. Heart sounds normal. No distress. Abdomen normal. No cervical lymphadenopathy. Throat normal. Ears normal
Advice to mobilise more. Review with results.

resource.comment: average 150/90 last six weeks
2 weeks cough - white sputum - no blood, 1 week nose running, 5 days sore throat, No shortness of breath
Similar problem 3 months ago - settled after 2 weeks
No locking.No effusion. No giving way
No effusion. Full range of movement. Ligaments normal

resource.comment: Analgesia advice, try knee support daytime
Overall doing better. Mood improving. Still gets bad days. Energy levels ok. Motivation improving. Started to go walking twice a week. First counsellor appointment due in two weeks.
MSE looks brighter. Not anxious. No DSH/hallucinations/abnormal thoughts

note.text: Pharmacy Notes: NOTES FOR PHARMACY, Patient Notes: Continue citalopram 20mg od. Encourage to take every day

resource.comment: Review in 4 weeks or earlier if problems
Patient reports the condition has cleared but develops cough when lies down to sleep.
Recommend that before sleep, patient has a hot drink. Sleep with head in elevated position.

MSE smiling. Not anxious. No DSH/hallucinations/abnormal thoughts
Review in 2 months or earlier if problems.

resource.comment: Swelling lower legs bilaterally. Mild pitting oedema. Heart sounds normal. Chest clear. No distress. Abdomen normal. No cervical lymphadenopathy. Throat normal. Ears normal. Swelling has noticeably reduced from examiniation two months ago. Blood count and ECG have not identified any cause.
Likely venous insufficiency
Refer to nurse for dopplers and if suitable support stockings.
